sentences.sContent: The cathedral is dwarfed by the surrounding skyscrapers.
sentences.sCn: 周围的摩天大楼使得大教堂显得很矮小。

phrases.pCn: 红矮星（表面温度较低且亮度较弱的恒星）

remMethod.val: 他把敌人画(draw)成了侏儒(dwarf)的形象

trans.tranOther: to be so big that other things are made to seem very small
a person who is a dwarf has not continued to grow to the normal height because of a medical condition. Many people think that this use is offensive.
a dwarf plant or animal is much smaller than the usual size
